content.description: On the back side with the big double-stacked roof, look under the low bottom roof for the huge left facing flake feature. Sit start matched on the top of the point of the lobe and make a huge move to the top lip. Negotiate the top lip, then top out with help from the upper block.

The big face line as you walk up to the Bad Boulder.  Directly in the center of the face.  Climb into the glorious finger crack and wonder through crimps and knobs until you hit the flat topout.  Out left are some knobs on top.  Good stuff.

Left of the starting flake/feature for "Two Bad" look for the lower big hueco just off the ground under the deep low roof. Move out to thin edges, then navigate tension moves to top out over the ledge under the high second roof. Hop off or walk around.

Under the roof on the main face, look below the blank face for the large, lowest flat jug with an old Budwiser can wedged behind a pebble. Sit start matched there (hands on either side of the can). Dyno your face off, straight up the wall to latch one of the two strange knobby protrusions in the break below the roof, about 6ft up. Climb directly out the roof to top out as per "Big Bad Wolf".

On the uphill end of the main face look for the dihedral under the roof. Sit start and the base of the dihedral with a right hand underclinging the edge in the bottom of the seam, left hand side-pulling the nothing seam. Pull up to the high chunk on the arete. Pull into the roof and top out over the corner of the roof.

Sit start under the front, main roof (just right of where the tree touches the lip of the roof). Match-start on the really nice low juggy rail (just left of the "King Bud Dyno" start) and toss up the the small round slopey pinch high on the face and the rail left of it. Climb direct, up into the break below the roof, the edge out of the roof and then to jugs on the upper face. Top out just right of where the tree touches the lip.

On the main front face under the nice roof, walk just left of the tree that touches the lip. Look for the low, large, pebbly jug flake/lobe to sit start matched on. Toss up the round edges, then into the roof. Pull crimps out of the roof and head up to the left of the close tree to top out just left of where the tree touches the boulder over the nice lip.

Tucked away in a Rhodo patch, Matt Kyle went on a vision quest in the forest and came upon this marvelous chunk of solitary stone. Bad Boulder has excellent stone, excellent landings and a host of fun terrain to choose from.
